brief_description: "Uttarakhand State Andolankari Pension" is a social welfare scheme implemented by the Department of Home, Government of Uttarakhand, that provides a monthly pension to the injured/jailed agitators during the Uttarakhand State Movement.
detailed_description: &quot;Uttarakhand State Andolankari Pension&quot; is a social welfare scheme implemented by the Department of Home, Government of Uttarakhand. Under this scheme, a monthly pension of ₹6,000/- is provided to the injured and those who were jailed for 7 days during the Uttarakhand State Movement, who did not get any employment due to any reason.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. The applicant must have taken part in the Uttarakhand State Movement. The applicant should have either been jailed for at least 7 days or injured during the movement. The applicant must not be employed in any job.

steps: Step 1: The applicant needs to submit an application to the office of the District Magistrate (there is no prescribed format for application). Step 2: Attach all the mandatory documents (Self-attested, if required) along with the application form. Step 3: Submit the application at the office of the District Magistrate.

documents_required: Application form. Any other documents as required.
